intro: Meliosma vasquezii, commonly known as the Mexican meliosma, is a rare evergreen shrub native to the highlands of Mexico. It belongs to the family Theaceae, which includes camellias and related genera. The plant is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the spring. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
